<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC RELATIONS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/businesses-executives-issue-statements-relating-protests?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Corporate America Joins the Movement
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Black out tuesday " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=453 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Lqaqc4NJc8YILyRnHA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Black out tuesday " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Lqaqc4NJc8YILyRnHA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As protests continue across the country, many prominent brands and business leaders have directly addressed racial inequality following the killing of George Floyd. A sampling: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Bank of America will </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-bank-of-america/bank-of-america-pledges-1-billion-to-address-racial-economic-inequality-idUSKBN2391NO?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">commit</a></span><span> $1 billion over the next four years to addressing racial and economic inequality. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Music execs Jamila Thomas and Brianna Agyemang </span><span><a href="https://www.theshowmustbepaused.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a></span><span> their industry to pause business on Tuesday and examine ways to support black communities. Millions of people joined in with an Instagram “blackout.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>GM CEO Mary Barra will </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/02/read-the-email-gm-ceo-mary-barra-sent-to-employees-about-george-floyd.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">commission</a></span><span> an inclusion advisory board of internal and external leaders.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Grindr will </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/1/21277315/grindr-ethnicity-filter-update-black-lives-matter-movement-protest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remove</a></span><span> ethnicity filters on its dating app. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Snap CEO Evan Spiegel </span><span><a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/snap-ceo-spiegel-calls-for-reparations-commission-taxes-to-address-racial-injustice?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called for</a></span><span> a reparations commission and taxes to address racial injustice. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This feels different</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2018, Nike made the controversial decision to name former NFL QB Colin Kaepernick as one of its spokespeople. Two years before that, Kaepernick famously took a knee during national anthems to protest racial inequality and police brutality, and was effectively locked out of the NFL afterward. <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/feb/14/sports-store-owner-who-boycotted-nike-over-colin-kaepernick-ads-closes-shop?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Despite boycotts</a>, Nike stood by its decision; sales and shares rose.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now it seems Nike was two years ahead of its time. Wharton marketing Prof. Americus Reed <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/01/with-protests-silence-is-not-an-option-corporate-america/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WaPo</a> companies have been making bolder statements condemning all forms of racial injustice during the ongoing protests. And silence or neutrality is not going unnoticed. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Companies also have public support. Civil rights, racial equality, and criminal justice reform are among the </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/the-issues-haunting-ceos-during-the-trump-era-9682f782-68b3-42c0-b357-cb578fbc6e84.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">least controversial</a></span><span> causes for brands to speak out on, according to Morning Consult. The most? Guns, abortion, immigration, and partisan campaign contributions. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A statement on social media =/= a pass on accountability. We all remember Pepsi’s <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90511890/how-that-pepsi-kendall-jenner-ad-taught-brands-to-respond-in-this-moment?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2017 ad</a> showing model Kendall Jenner handing a police officer a soda during a protest. And we all remember how mocked it was for trivializing protests against racial injustice.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As they speak out against racism, many companies will face (or are already facing) scrutiny over their own actions, business practices that have hurt people of color, and a lack of diversity, especially in executive ranks.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/zoom-reports-stellar-earnings-fiscal-q1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Zoombombing Expectations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Zoom IPO" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDgvem9vbV9pcG8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kena Betancur/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the videoconferencing company Zoom reported fiscal Q1 earnings that give you that triumphant “Leave Meeting” feeling. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Zoom </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/02/zoom-zm-earnings-q1-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled in</a></span><span> $328.2 million in revenue compared to $202.7 million expected for the quarter ended April 30. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Our now-obligatory earnings caveat: Analysts are contending with an extremely uncertain environment, so beating expectations is a little less straightforward these days.    </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still...we’re looking at ridiculous numbers. Zoom’s revenue grew 169% year over year; the previous quarter, revenue grew 78%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Zoom mobile app added an estimated 159 million monthly active users between March 4 and May 27, according to a Bernstein note that cited Apptopia data. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its stock is up more than 200% year to date.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>With its super-simple user experience and successful freemium model, Zoom was well-positioned to catch the videoconferencing wave when workplaces went WFH and birthday parties went BDFH. But <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/09/zoom-fire-security-privacy-lapses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Zoom stumbled in April</a> over privacy and security issues, and competitors like Microsoft Teams, Cisco’s Webex, and even Facebook’s Messenger Rooms aim to chip away at its lead. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/markets-shrug-off-end-times?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Markets Shrug Off the End of Times
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. cities are experiencing one of the most widespread protests in generations. A global pandemic has killed more than 105,000 Americans in four months. GDP could fall <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/02/gdp-is-now-projected-to-fall-nearly-53percent-in-the-second-quarter-according-to-a-fed-gauge.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly 53%</a> in Q2. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Surely the stock market is collaps—</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QMHoU66sBXqqLqYvGO/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 519px;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Giphy</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Dow and S&P hit <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/sp-500-dow-scale-fresh-three-month-peaks-idUSKBN2391E7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three-month highs yesterday</a> as investors ignored the apocalyptic vibes and focused instead on states reopening their economies following coronavirus shutdowns. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The S&P has bounced almost 40% off its March low and is only ~10% from a record high.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Nasdaq, full of jubilant tech stocks, is “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-01/nasdaq-100-is-one-big-rally-from-putting-the-selloff-behind-it?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one big rally</a></span><span>” from eclipsing its record, writes Bloomberg.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s happening: </strong>Investors are paying attention to the protests, but they’re not going to sell stocks unless they believe tensions will materially impact public companies’ financials (spoiler alert: they don’t). Investors view the fight against COVID-19 as a much better indicator of future economic growth, which is why <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/01/business/moderna-vaccine-stock-sales-invs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vaccine whispers</a> drive more stock market action than images of burning cities. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY CISCO WEBEX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Good Luck Messing With This Video Conference Call
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3415888MEDIAMOBILIZE/B23005679.273721123;dc_trk_aid=468098542;dc_trk_cid=126469973;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cisco WebEx" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNzMxLzE1OTExMDYzMjAtV2ViZXhTZWN1cml0eVNwb3RsaWdodFhMLUNvbGxhYl8yX19fMV8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our job hasn’t changed: We still fill your inbox with freshly brewed business news each morning. Except now we do it from home. And with so many companies doing the same, more and more are turning to <a href="https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__ad.doubleclick.net_ddm_trackclk_N7442.3415888MEDIAMOBILIZE_B23005679.273721123-3Bdc-5Ftrk-5Faid-3D468098542-3Bdc-5Ftrk-5Fcid-3D126469973-3Bdc-5Flat-3D-3Bdc-5Frdid-3D-3Btag-5Ffor-5Fchild-5Fdirected-5Ftreatment-3D-3Btfua-3D&d=DwMFaQ&c=pBpWB3g5lxYDsRBNURdZrQ&r=PafyAWualHC0adUtSEmntmXbhGKa6hZR1TZ0XBoDgPA&m=1O5rhHPK0L2ST8JmQS5fKjjwob6wzqfxYv4Vx3NPdBo&s=0nH0rw8V2rbm3pD2GsCM5joEj-vODqPFXVe-AQuV3Z0&e=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Webex</a> for video communication that ensures their teams can work together securely.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In order for us all to keep doing our best, we need video conferencing that keeps the video-bombers out. Webex makes it simple to reliably connect with one another <a href="https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__ad.doubleclick.net_ddm_trackclk_N7442.3415888MEDIAMOBILIZE_B23005679.273721123-3Bdc-5Ftrk-5Faid-3D468098542-3Bdc-5Ftrk-5Fcid-3D126469973-3Bdc-5Flat-3D-3Bdc-5Frdid-3D-3Btag-5Ffor-5Fchild-5Fdirected-5Ftreatment-3D-3Btfua-3D&d=DwMFaQ&c=pBpWB3g5lxYDsRBNURdZrQ&r=PafyAWualHC0adUtSEmntmXbhGKa6hZR1TZ0XBoDgPA&m=7FNHLZ9PNChCWvxhhoVapS5dOCXrx2dNQOcGLKBu9o8&s=_uoAXcN8_avVpf2whnCIn52M2zmSTa5bo0k4klkyEwY&e=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no matter where you are</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Webex is the go-to video communication tool for heads of state, governments, schools, medical providers, and the world’s most trusted brands.</strong> Which means you can trust it for your small business, too. <tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/countries-begin-lifting-restrictions-despite-mounting-covid19-cases?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Countries Are Itching to Reopen, Virus and All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="COVID-19" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTk5L2JyYXppbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Andressa Anholete/Getty Images | Artists pay homage to the 30,000+ people who have died from COVID-19 in Brazil.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some countries have begun lifting restrictions on businesses despite growing COVID-19 case tallies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In India</strong>, restaurants, hotels, and places of worship <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-52862160?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be allowed</a> to reopen Monday, June 8. But the country, the world’s second-largest by population, hit a new record on Saturday for a single-day rise in cases at almost 8,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In Pakistan,</strong> Prime Minister Imran Khan <a href="https://www.aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/pakistan-says-no-more-lockdown-despite-surging-cases/1861142?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said lockdowns</a> will broadly end except for a few sectors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Several South American countries</strong>, including Bolivia, Ecuador, and Venezuela, <a href="https://apnews.com/158742b977ca7968049b5c76111c1e84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will also loosen</a> restrictions. Brazil, which has suffered the second-largest number of cases worldwide, is opening up some of its most devastated regions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> These countries are crying uncle under the economic pain of lockdowns. "Unfortunately, the [previous] lockdown has already hit the poor people,” Khan said. “We have to save our people from coronavirus and hunger simultaneously.” As for Latin America, the UN’s regional office <a href="https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1062292?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">projected</a> in April that the pandemic will inflict the worst recession since 1930. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mask Your Enthusiasm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="DTC panel newsletter crop" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83ODgvZ2xvYmVfd2l0aF9hX21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the early days of the coronavirus pandemic, retailers from LVMH to Eddie Bauer began churning out medical-grade PPE masks to support healthcare efforts—and keep the lights on while lockdowns slashed demand for discretionary products.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then, in March and April, regular ol’ consumers learned we had to wear masks in public places, creating massive demand for sub-medical grade (but still crucial to public health) cloth masks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sellers on DIY e-commerce site Etsy sold 12 million face masks in April, generating $133 million in total sales.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the 30 days leading up to May 18, there was one face mask-related search on Etsy every .5 seconds.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Where are we now? </strong>The maskstravaganza continues, but analysts say apparel retailers are still in the wilderness.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are masks situational products that we only bring out for crowded events like concerts? Will people want a new one every week? Or use the same one for years?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A Morning Brew Original:</strong> To learn more about the mask market, read our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/02/masks-prove-puzzling-new-retail-category?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest piece</a> on apparel's new wild west.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">Whether you’re rocking it as a weekday undershirt, a weekend statement piece, or you’re just looking to cause a stir at Aunt Margaret’s black tie wedding, our comfy tees will get the job done.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">Whether you’re rocking it as a weekday undershirt, a weekend statement piece, or you’re just looking to cause a stir at Aunt Margaret’s black tie wedding, our comfy tees will get the job done.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-top:15px;margin-bottom:15px;line-height:22px;">To traditionalists, it’s a crewneck. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs protests continue across the country, many prominent brands and business leaders have directly addressed racial inequality following the killing of George Floyd. A sampling: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBank of America will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-bank-of-america/bank-of-america-pledges-1-billion-to-address-racial-economic-inequality-idUSKBN2391NO?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecommit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $1 billion over the next four years to addressing racial and economic inequality. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMusic execs Jamila Thomas and Brianna Agyemang \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theshowmustbepaused.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their industry to pause business on Tuesday and examine ways to support black communities. Millions of people joined in with an Instagram “blackout.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGM CEO Mary Barra will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/02/read-the-email-gm-ceo-mary-barra-sent-to-employees-about-george-floyd.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecommission\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e an inclusion advisory board of internal and external leaders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGrindr will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/1/21277315/grindr-ethnicity-filter-update-black-lives-matter-movement-protest?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremove\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e ethnicity filters on its dating app. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSnap CEO Evan Spiegel \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/articles/snap-ceo-spiegel-calls-for-reparations-commission-taxes-to-address-racial-injustice?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalled for\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a reparations commission and taxes to address racial injustice. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis feels different\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2018, Nike made the controversial decision to name former NFL QB Colin Kaepernick as one of its spokespeople. Two years before that, Kaepernick famously took a knee during national anthems to protest racial inequality and police brutality, and was effectively locked out of the NFL afterward. \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/business/2019/feb/14/sports-store-owner-who-boycotted-nike-over-colin-kaepernick-ads-closes-shop?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDespite boycotts\u003c/a\u003e, Nike stood by its decision; sales and shares rose.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow it seems Nike was two years ahead of its time. Wharton marketing Prof. Americus Reed \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/06/01/with-protests-silence-is-not-an-option-corporate-america/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e companies have been making bolder statements condemning all forms of racial injustice during the ongoing protests. And silence or neutrality is not going unnoticed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCompanies also have public support. Civil rights, racial equality, and criminal justice reform are among the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/the-issues-haunting-ceos-during-the-trump-era-9682f782-68b3-42c0-b357-cb578fbc6e84.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleast controversial\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e causes for brands to speak out on, according to Morning Consult. The most? Guns, abortion, immigration, and partisan campaign contributions. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA statement on social media =/= a pass on accountability. We all remember Pepsi’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90511890/how-that-pepsi-kendall-jenner-ad-taught-brands-to-respond-in-this-moment?utm_source=feedly\u0026utm_medium=webfeeds\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2017 ad\u003c/a\u003e showing model Kendall Jenner handing a police officer a soda during a protest. And we all remember how mocked it was for trivializing protests against racial injustice.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs they speak out against racism, many companies will face (or are already facing) scrutiny over their own actions, business practices that have hurt people of color, and a lack of diversity, especially in executive ranks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F02%2Fbusinesses-executives-issue-statements-relating-protests\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDgvem9vbV9pcG8uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKena Betancur/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the videoconferencing company Zoom reported fiscal Q1 earnings that give you that triumphant “Leave Meeting” feeling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eZoom \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/02/zoom-zm-earnings-q1-2021.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled in\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $328.2 million in revenue compared to $202.7 million expected for the quarter ended April 30. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOur now-obligatory earnings caveat: Analysts are contending with an extremely uncertain environment, so beating expectations is a little less straightforward these days.    \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill...we’re looking at ridiculous numbers. Zoom’s revenue grew 169% year over year; the previous quarter, revenue grew 78%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Zoom mobile app added an estimated 159 million monthly active users between March 4 and May 27, according to a Bernstein note that cited Apptopia data. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIts stock is up more than 200% year to date.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWith its super-simple user experience and successful freemium model, Zoom was well-positioned to catch the videoconferencing wave when workplaces went WFH and birthday parties went BDFH. But \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/09/zoom-fire-security-privacy-lapses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eZoom stumbled in April\u003c/a\u003e over privacy and security issues, and competitors like Microsoft Teams, Cisco’s Webex, and even Facebook’s Messenger Rooms aim to chip away at its lead. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn India\u003c/strong\u003e, restaurants, hotels, and places of worship \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-52862160?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be allowed\u003c/a\u003e to reopen Monday, June 8. But the country, the world’s second-largest by population, hit a new record on Saturday for a single-day rise in cases at almost 8,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn Pakistan,\u003c/strong\u003e Prime Minister Imran Khan \u003ca href=\"https://www.aa.com.tr/en/asia-pacific/pakistan-says-no-more-lockdown-despite-surging-cases/1861142?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid lockdowns\u003c/a\u003e will broadly end except for a few sectors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSeveral South American countries\u003c/strong\u003e, including Bolivia, Ecuador, and Venezuela, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/158742b977ca7968049b5c76111c1e84?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill also loosen\u003c/a\u003e restrictions. Brazil, which has suffered the second-largest number of cases worldwide, is opening up some of its most devastated regions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e These countries are crying uncle under the economic pain of lockdowns. \"Unfortunately, the [previous] lockdown has already hit the poor people,” Khan said. “We have to save our people from coronavirus and hunger simultaneously.” As for Latin America, the UN’s regional office \u003ca href=\"https://news.un.org/en/story/2020/04/1062292?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid
